text: what's the best way to cook and serve a
butternut squash one way to do it
you take your squash you have it
lengthwise scoop out the seeds put it
cut side up on a baking sheet dot it
with butter sprinkle it with spices and
salt little maple syrup some cayenne
delicious 375 until it's tender the
problem with that is when you're serving
people at Thanksgiving it's kind of a
pain to serve because you have to scoop
it out and it's a little bit awkward so
instead when I'm feeding a crowd what I
like to do is peel it with a vegetable
peeler trim off the ends so you want to
just take out the seeds and if you want
you can actually toast these just like
pumpkin seeds just toss them with olive
oil and salt and roast them in a low
oven like 325 until they get crispy and
brown such a good nutritious snack cut
it up into cubes about one and a half
inches toss it with olive oil or butter
salt pepper garam masala it's delicious
a little bit of brown sugar or whatever
you like cumin is good you could do this
in a bowl if you'd rather but I say why
dirty Bowl you've got enough dishes to
do on Thanksgiving as it is so I just do
it right on the track and then you want
to spread it out
ideally you don't want the pieces really
touching each other they get browner
that way if they have a lot of room and
then I roasted at 425 until it's golden
and caramelized and here you go golden
tender you could garnish this with some
chopped sage or some chopped scallions
so good
